oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Cunne Shote
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Portrait of Cunne Shote (Oconostota) holding a knife. He wears both Native and European clothing and has a silver gorget with George the III's initials on it as well as British medals.
Cunne Shote was one of the three Cherokee leaders who traveled to London with Henry Timberlake in 1762 for a diplomatic visit. He sat for the artist Francis Parsons during his visit to London.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Parsons, Francis
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Indians of North America; Cherokee Indians--History; Cherokee Indians; Gorgets (Military insignia); Indians of North America--Portraits
Clothing & dress; Knives; Medals
